item.value: The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The blue whale can produce sounds up to 188 decibels. This is the loudest sound produced by a living animal and has been detected as far away as 530 miles.
Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
China has the largest population of any country. It has over 1.3 billion people.

On 12 April 1961 Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin, a Soviet cosmonaut , became the first human in outer space and the first to orbit the Earth. He became a hero of the Soviet Union for his pioneering tour in space.
The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
The first letter of every continent's name is the same as the last: AmericA, AntarcticA, EuropE, AsiA, AustraliA, AfricA.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
Tides are caused by the rotation of the Earth and the gravitational effects of the Moon and Sun.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is young in comparison, it is only 4.6 billion years old.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is thirteen seconds
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters. The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters ( 2,717 ft ) tall.
The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered, sustained, and controlled flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903. In 1919 the First transatlantic flight was made.
